ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:0.5_0: The second training rule on eyes
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were looking here and there while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.3.1_0: “‘I will sit with lowered eyes in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.4_0: One should lower one’s eyes while sitting in an inhabited area, looking a plow’s length ahead.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, looks here and there while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.13_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.14_0: The eighth training rule is finished.
